general_advisory: February-March is the ideal time for sowing of cowpea, cluster bean, pumpkin, cucumber, and watermelon. Transplanting of vegetables should be done in the afternoon hour to avoid high temperature. Harvest the mustard crop as soon as the pods turn yellowish-brown. Harvest the potato crop when the majority of the leaves turn yellowish-brown.

advisory: If pre-emergence herbicides were not applied in paddy, to control weeds spray Bispyribacsodium @ 120 ml /acre at 10-12 DAS or, 2-3 leaf stage of weeds or, Penoxsulum 1.02% + Cyhalofop-butyl 5.1 % @ 800ml/acre at 15-20 DAS in 140 litres of water.

Yellow Stem Borer management: To manage stem borer in paddy at an early stage of the crop, apply Cartap Hydrochloride 4 % G (@ 8-kg/acre or Fipronil 0.3 % GR @ 10-kg/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 0.4 % GR @ 4-kg/acre or Imidacloprid 0.3% GR @ 6-kg/acre by mixing it with sand at 1: 1 ratio.

Sett Rot management: To manage sett rot disease after planting basal drenching with Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% @ 400-gram/acre or foliar spray with Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP @ 400-gram/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.

Aphids: To control aphids during the primary stage of pest infestation spray Neem-Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 1500 PPM @ 600 ml/acre. Then spray Thiamethoxam 25% W.G @ 40 gram/acre or Acetamiprid 20% S.P. @ 50 gram/acre or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 60-ml/acre by mixing in 200 liters of water.

Aphid: To control aphids during the primary stage of pest infestation spray Neem-Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 1500 PPM @ 600 ml/acre. Then spray Thiamethoxam 25% W.G @ 40 gram/acre or Acetamiprid 20% S.P. @ 50 gram/acre or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 60-ml/acre by mixing in 200 liters of water.

Little Leaf of Brinjal: To manage little leaf in brinjal first remove and destroy the infected plant. To manage the vector of the disease spray Thiamethoxam 25 % WG @ 40-gram/acre or Flonicamid 50% WG @ 60-gram/acre or Dinotefuran 20 % SG @ 80-gram/acre.

Leaf Webber and Head Borer management: To manage leaf webber and head borer pests, regular monitoring of pest infestation should be carried out. Collect and destroy the caterpillars and egg masses in the early stages of pest attack. Spray Neem-Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 300 PPM @ 1-liter /acre by mixing in 200-liter of water. To manage these pests chemically spray Tolfenpyrad 15 % EC@ 400-ml/acre or Flubendiamide 20 % WG @ 20-gram/acre or Chlorfenapyr 10 % SC @ 400-ml/acre or Spinosad 45 % SC @ 75-ml/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water.
